results.title: Kids making decisions
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Corporate Relations Unit and Victoria. Inner City School Support Centre
results.brief_description: A program for primary teachers highlighting key features in developing integrated curriculum. An integrated curriculum goes beyond a thematic approach and involves coordinating all curriculum areas around one chosen topic to promote the development of learning. Shows teachers and their classes in three Western Metropolitan schools involved in choosing a topic, ordering concept areas and contributing questions. The pupils are involved by taking responsibility for their own learning in making key decisions.

results.title: Sunrise profession: land degradation hypothetical
results.creator_credit: John Nairn, John Nicholson and La Trobe University
results.brief_description: Part 1. An introduction to the School of Agriculture courses at La Trobe University, highlighting hi-tech science, state of the art facilities, applied problem solving, global issues, real world economics, innovative teaching and breakthough research. Part 2. An agricultural hypothetical teaching exercise on land degradation dealing with the salinity problems in northern Victoria.

results.title: The Memphis belle: the story of a flying fortress
results.creator_credit: William Wyler and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: The story of the B-17 bomber Memphis Belle on its final mission over Germany to bomb the submarine pens at Wilhelmshaven as told by William Wyler. Shows the 8th Bomber Command air crews being briefed and ground crew preparations. Contains rare wartime footage of actual combat conditions.

results.title: Report from the Aleutians
results.creator_credit: John Huston and United States. Army. Signal Corps
results.brief_description: A documentary of life on a lonely airbase on Adak Island in the Aleutians during World War II. For the men of the base, the enemy was the snow, mud, grey skies and boredom punctuated by an occasional bombing raid. John Huston spent six months on the Island and was nearly killed while filming the climactic raid.

results.title: Pearl Harbour December 7th
results.brief_description: A few cameras were on hand to record the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7th 1941, film director John Ford’s unit was given the task of recreating many of the major scenes on Hollywood sound stages. Generations of Americans have witnessed the scenes, not realising the attack is actually Ford’s skilful illusion. Historically, the film is accurate in every detail. Winner of the Academy Award for Documentary Production in 1943.

results.title: Take heart
results.creator_credit: Penny Cordell, Film and Television Institute (W.A.) and Women's Film Fund AFC
results.brief_description: Western Australia nuclar disarmament protesters tell how they became active protesters against the United States nuclear ships using Coburn Sound. With the help of Dr Helen Caldicott the Nuclear Disarmement Party was formed in 1948 and they campaigned to have Senator Jo Valentine elected to the Australian Parliament. Shows how a small grassroots level group can succed in political ctivity.

results.title: Family of chimps
results.brief_description: A documentary recording the day-to-day activities of a chimpanzee family living in an open enclosure surrounded by a moat at Burgers Zoo in Arnheim. Scientists and the public observe their behaviour unobtrusively from a distance.

results.title: VFL: skills
results.brief_description: Step-by-step Australian Rules instructions, skills and techniques demonstrated by senior VFL players. A vital tool in mastering all aspects of this modern, national game for all kids. Includes interviews with Dennis Carroll, Tim Watson and Todd Viney. No other credits available.
